name: Hotel Elysa Luxembourg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel on merits of other trip advisors and were very glad we did.stayed 15th-18th Aug for our 25 wedding anniversary on our first trip to Paris.on our arrival the management had a bottle of champagne chilled in our room (nice touch).Our room was a good size and very clean.We had a small balcony and could see the Elfille tower.The location of this hotel is hard to beat,close to RER stop,and a leisurely 15minute walk to river Seine.the Luxemburg gardens were just around the corner and were a beautiful place to relax and have a snack.The hotel staff were very helpful recomending eating places and best forms of transport for sight-seeing,when we return to paris we will be staying here again.
reviews.title: Location and Hospitality first class

reviews.text: We needed a base for a one night stay in Paris and the Hotel Elysa Luxembourg was ideal. The website is informative and it was easy to make a reservation. We arrived and the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. We had the same friendly service when we checked out. The hotel is easy to get to on the RER/Metro and is located on a main street. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but in a nearby cafe overlooking the Jardin du Luxembourg. The room was quiet despite being on a main street and it was very clean and tidy. I would definitely visit Paris and stay in the Elysa Luxembourg again. The reception was also manned late at night which was nice after having been out late enjoying the city.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Stayed 26-30 Nov 08 with wife, baby and friends. Booked direct with hotel on '3 days or more' rate - couldn't find cheaper for this location near central Paris.
reviews.title: Great Value Paris Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Tiny lift, small bath without shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both rooms slightly larger than expected for Paris hotel. Plenty of space for travel cot (provided) next to double bed. Immaculately clean. Slightly dated decor but perfectly functional and in good condition.
reviews.title: Excellent location.

likes.disliked: — Room a tad small but not really a dislike.

reviews.text: Great location next to Luxembourg Park. Short walk to Seine, Notre Dame, Louvre.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Small lift! But at least it had one!!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, 3 adults and 3 children. Arrived from Charles de Gaulle airport by the RER-B commuter train. The hotel is located only 50 meters or so from the subway entrance, which is really convenient. (BTW: Avoid large-sized luggage if you use the Paris subway system).
reviews.title: Good value for money

likes.disliked: — No free Internet, some traffic noise (tolerable, though)

reviews.title: Average hotel, but good location.
reviews.text: The rooms are not very large, but absolutely big enough. Good beds. Clean and well maintained.
As the hotel faces a major through-street, the traffic noise (especially in the morning) may be somewhat disturbing; not uncommon in any big city…
reviews.title: Met our needs perfectly. A real find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very friendly and service minded, and they spoke good or excellent English. The front desk is manned 24/7.
reviews.title: OK, a little quirky, but great location

reviews.text: The breakfast at €12,50 was too pricy; there is a bakery just 10 meters from the hotel entrance that sells excellent sandwiches (not on Sundays), a 8-huit convenience store across the street (closed Sundays as well) and the Luxembourg garden is only 75 meters away. At least in the summer, and if it's not raining, a breakfast picnic is well worth considering.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Elysa-Luxmebourg is in a great location, right near all the tourist sites. It was convenient to the train station and was easy to reach from the airport. The room was clean. 24-hour reception which was great for security.
reviews.title: Great location... close to Pantheon

reviews.text: It was disappointing that they did not have an iron/ironing board and the airconditioning was not working. They also didn't have traditional hotel services i.e. a restaurant, do not disturb sign etc, however there is a selection of restaurants near the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a fantastic location. It takes no more than 15-20 minutes, on the RER, from Gare du Nord to the nearest station, Luxembourg. Many of the major tourist sites are within easy strolling distance, for example, Notre Dame is approximately 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Close to the hotel is a large selection of restaurants offering every cuisine you can think of at prices to suit all budgets. My friend and I (two older ladies) felt entirely safe and unthreatened in this vibrant, bustling and very lively area. However, we were concerned that our room would be noisy at night, particularly, as our room faced directly onto the main road. Surprisingly, we found that noise from the street just wasn't an issue and the insulation between rooms in the hotel was also very good. If you like to sleep with the window open at night, then you probably will be distrurbed by the street-life. When we were there, the nights were very warm and sultry however, the air conditioning in the room was both effective and very quite and so we had no need to open the window. I've visited Paris on many occasions, and I'd say that this is one of the quietest hotels I've stayed at. On arrival, and during our stay, the hotel staff were helpful and friendly and they were happy to converse in English (fluently) without making us feel guilty or inadequate about our total lack of French. Our twin room and well-equipped bathroom were both spotlessly clean and surprisingly good-sized rooms bearing in mind that Paris hotel rooms are notoriously small. At no time did we feel that we, or our possessions, were at any risk. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a safe, clean, comfortable base in a brilliant location and, at a rate (that I feel at least) represents good value for money.
reviews.title: Good location, low return on investment

reviews.text: Location, 15sec walk from the Luxembourg RER station.
reviews.title: Loved the location and price

reviews.text: Just returned from first visit to Paris, overall enjoyed the 3 day break.
reviews.title: Be Prepared

description: The heart of the Latin Quarter beats just a short step away: the Luxemburg gardens, boulevard Saint-Michel, the Sorbonne, Notre-Dame and the Pantheon are all in the vicinity. Lovers of Old Paris who enjoy strolling through these streets steeped in history will appreciate the comfortable, typically Parisian setting of the Elysa-Luxembourg Hotel in the Latin Quarter. Sheltered from the bustle of the busiest thoroughfares, the Elysa-Luxembourg hotel combines the charm of a beautiful old stone building, the cosy interior of rooms decorated in contemporary style with the efficiency of modern facilities. Some of the thirty rooms offer a magnificent view over neighbouring rooftoops, the paths through the nearby Luxemburg gardens or even the Eiffel Tower. In this discretely refined setting, the atmosphere is decisively warm and the service resolutely attentive.
